title: elasticsearch API Cheat Sheet
author: soonfy <soonfy@163.com>
description: Elasticsearch is a distributed, RESTful search and analytics engine capable of solving a growing number of use cases. As the heart of the Elastic Stack, it centrally stores your data so you can discover the expected and uncover the unexpected.

methods.name: client.bulk([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Perform many index/delete operations in a single API call.

methods.name: client.clearScroll([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Clear the scroll request created by specifying the scroll parameter to search.

methods.name: client.count([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Get the number of documents for the cluster, index, type, or a query.

methods.name: client.countPercolate([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.create([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Adds a typed JSON document in a specific index, making it searchable. If a document with the same index, type, and id already exists, an error will occur.

methods.name: client.delete([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Delete a typed JSON document from a specific index based on its id.

methods.name: client.deleteByQuery([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Delete documents from one or more indices and one or more types based on a query.

methods.name: client.deleteScript([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.deleteTemplate([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.exists([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Returns a boolean indicating whether or not a given document exists.

methods.name: client.explain([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Provides details about a specific documentâ€™s score in relation to a specific query. It will also tell you if the document matches the specified query. Also check out percolaters.

methods.name: client.fieldStats([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.get([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Get a typed JSON document from the index based on its id.

methods.name: client.getScript([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.getSource([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Get the source of a document by its index, type and id.

methods.name: client.getTemplate([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.index([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Stores a typed JSON document in an index, making it searchable. When the id param is not set, a unique id will be auto-generated. When you specify an id either a new document will be created, or an existing document will be updated. To enforce "put-if-absent" behavior set the opType to "create" or use the create() method.

methods.name: client.info([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Get basic info from the current cluster.

methods.name: client.mget([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Get multiple documents based on an index, type (optional) and ids. The body required by mget can take two forms: an array of document locations, or an array of document ids.

methods.name: client.mpercolate([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.msearch([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Execute several search requests within the same request.

methods.name: client.msearchTemplate([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.mtermvectors([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.percolate([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Match a document against registered percolator queries.

methods.name: client.ping([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.putScript([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.putTemplate([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.reindex([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.reindexRethrottle([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.renderSearchTemplate([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.scroll([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Scroll a search request (retrieve the next set of results) after specifying the scroll parameter in a search() call.

methods.name: client.search([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Return documents matching a query, aggregations/facets, highlighted snippets, suggestions, and more. Write your queries as either simple query strings in the q parameter, or by specifying a full request definition using the Elasticsearch Query DSL in the body parameter.

methods.name: client.searchShards([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.searchTemplate([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.suggest([params, [callback]])
methods.description: The suggest feature suggests similar looking terms based on a provided text by using a specific suggester.

methods.name: client.termvectors([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.update([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Update parts of a document. The required body parameter can contain one of two things:

methods.name: client.cluster.getSettings([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Get cluster settings (previously set with putSettings())

methods.name: client.cluster.health([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Get a very simple status on the health of the cluster.

methods.name: client.cluster.pendingTasks([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.cluster.putSettings([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Update cluster wide specific settings.

methods.name: client.cluster.reroute([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Explicitly execute a cluster reroute allocation command including specific commands.

methods.name: client.cluster.state([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Get comprehensive details about the state of the whole cluster (indices settings, allocations, etc).

methods.name: client.cluster.stats([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.indices.analyze([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Perform the analysis process on a text and return the tokens breakdown of the text.

methods.name: client.indices.clearCache([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Clear either all caches or specific cached associated with one ore more indices.

methods.name: client.indices.close([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Close an index to remove its overhead from the cluster. Closed index is blocked for read/write operations.

methods.name: client.indices.create([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Create an index in Elasticsearch.

methods.name: client.indices.delete([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Delete an index in Elasticsearch

methods.name: client.indices.deleteAlias([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Delete a specific alias.

methods.name: client.indices.deleteTemplate([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Delete an index template by its name.

methods.name: client.indices.exists([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Return a boolean indicating whether given index exists.

methods.name: client.indices.existsAlias([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Return a boolean indicating whether given alias exists.

methods.name: client.indices.existsTemplate([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.indices.existsType([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check if a type/types exists in an index/indices.

methods.name: client.indices.flush([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Explicitly flush one or more indices.

methods.name: client.indices.flushSynced([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.indices.forcemerge([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.indices.getAlias([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Retrieve a specified alias.

methods.name: client.indices.getFieldMapping([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Retrieve mapping definition of a specific field.

methods.name: client.indices.getMapping([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Retrieve mapping definition of index or index/type.

methods.name: client.indices.getSettings([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Retrieve settings for one or more (or all) indices.

methods.name: client.indices.getTemplate([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Retrieve an index template by its name.

methods.name: client.indices.getUpgrade([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.indices.open([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Open a closed index, making it available for search.

methods.name: client.indices.putAlias([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Create an alias for a specific index/indices.

methods.name: client.indices.putMapping([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Register specific mapping definition for a specific type.

methods.name: client.indices.putSettings([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Change specific index level settings in real time.

methods.name: client.indices.putTemplate([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Create an index template that will automatically be applied to new indices created.

methods.name: client.indices.recovery([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.indices.refresh([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Explicitly refresh one or more index, making all operations performed since the last refresh available for search.

methods.name: client.indices.rollover([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.indices.segments([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Retrieve low level segments information that a Lucene index (shard level) is built with.

methods.name: client.indices.stats([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Retrieve statistics on different operations happening on an index.

methods.description: Update specified aliases.

methods.description: Check the API Conventions and the elasticsearch docs for more information pertaining to this method.

methods.name: client.indices.validateQuery([params, [callback]])
methods.description: Validate a potentially expensive query without executing it.
